image.altText: A collage of the Premier and Scott McDougall and the justice statue.

items.synopsis: The government's approach could risk alienating parts of Labor's traditionally progressive supporter base and leave itself open to more attacks from other political parties.

title.children: The Palaszczuk government has become engulfed in a political storm of its own making

image.altText: A graphic image of a broken "for lease" sign against a background of grid paper. A line of cartoon people run behind it.

items.synopsis: Across the housing sector, from renters to real estate agents and landlords, there's broad agreement that Australia's rental system needs an overhaul — and fast. The problem is, few agree on what that change should look like.

title.children: 'This has been a long time coming': How the cracks in Australia's rental market were revealed

image.altText: A window shows a pink sun set over an airplane.

items.synopsis: It's the sneaky travel hack that's been used by savvy consumers for years. Here's what we know about skiplagging.

title.children: What is skiplagging? The travel hack long hated by airlines is now the subject of a big lawsuit

image.altText: President of Spain's soccer federation, Luis Rubiales, right, hugs Spain's Aitana Bonmati.

items.synopsis: Spanish soccer player Jenni Hermoso says that "in no moment" did she consent to a kiss on the lips by soccer federation president Luis Rubiales at the Women's World Cup final.

title.children: Spanish footballer says kiss from federation president was not consensual, World Cup winners refuse to play in protest

image.altText: A woman walks down an aisle of a supermarket. Products on shelves either side of her.

items.synopsis: Supermarket theft is on the rise, costing the industry hundreds of millions of dollars annually. The crime wave is not just hitting Australia — it's proving to be a major global issue as inflation pressures bite and organised gangs seize opportunities.

title.children: Supermarkets roll out high tech to catch shoplifters as cost-of-living pressures bite

image.altText: Ken Henry #4

items.synopsis: The latest Intergenerational Report paints a picture of an Australian landscape working in a very different way to ones we have seen in the past. There is no room for blank spots, writes Laura Tingle.

title.children: Australia is facing an intergenerational 'tragedy' that demands big picture discussions about the future

image.altText: Four Warriors NRL players celebrate a try against the Dragons.

items.synopsis: A year after finishing second last on the ladder, the Warriors will enjoy the double chance in the finals, while North Queensland keeps its season alive.

title.children: Warriors applauded after 'unbelievable achievement', Cowboys stay in finals contention

image.altText: A man lifts a large snake into the air as he moves it into a safety bin.

items.synopsis: Experts say the two-metre eastern brown caught near Armidale is a sign that snakes are well fed and active earlier than normal across parts of New South Wales.

title.children: Monster eastern brown snake found in a veggie patch

image.altText: Yevgeny Prigozhin leaves a cemetery. He is bald and stares at the camera from a distance.

items.synopsis: Once a petty criminal who served time in a Russian penal colony for stealing a woman's boots off her feet, Yevgeny Prigozhin cut a ruthless path to power. His end may have been just as violent.

title.children: Prigozhin's appetite for violence and his raw ambition propelled his life. It also destroyed him

image.altText: Laughing baby touches women's face surrounded by golden sunlight

items.synopsis: As a new mother on a picturesque cattle station, Maddie told her friends and family she was happy. The reality was the opposite. But an unexpected conversation changed everything for the better.

title.children: With a happy baby and a dream job, Maddie turned to her partner and said, 'I'm miserable'

image.altText: A man and a woman look at each other, smiling, standing on a deck with trees behind.

items.synopsis: Spending more time together during COVID-19 lockdowns convinced Adam and Sarah Louise Spencer they needed a change from the Gold Coast. So they left behind the city and moved to a national park about 500 kilometres north-west of Brisbane.

title.children: From the Gold Coast to the doorstep of an ancient gorge, the Spencer family is embracing a lifestyle change

image.altText: All Blacks player stand on the field after losing to the Springboks at Twickenham.

items.synopsis: Two weeks out from their Rugby World Cup opener, the All Blacks are on the receiving end of a 35-7 thrashing dished out by the Springboks, who flex their muscles ahead of their title defence in France.

title.children: 'It stings': All Blacks handed heaviest defeat in their history

image.altText: Rescue workers in helmets and masks wheel a stretcher loaded with gear along pavement under a yellow police tape.

items.synopsis: With low murder rates and strict firearm controls, South Korea has long been considered safe but after a recent series of stabbing rampages some are calling for greater police powers and harsher sentences for violent crimes.

title.children: South Korea rocked by 'don't ask why' stabbing attacks

image.altText: A close up of a grey, fluffy koala in a tree, looking right at the camera.

items.synopsis: Dog owners living in parts of the Gold Coast must now follow strict rules or face fines under tough laws designed to keep koalas safe. But wildlife rescuers fear the plan could backfire.

title.children: New fences, dogs inside at night, backyard escape routes required under council's new koala protection laws

image.altText: A St George Illawarra NRLW player runs with the ball in two hands during a match.

items.synopsis: St George Illawarra faces Gold Coast in the second match of the double-header at Kogarah Jubilee Oval. Earlier, bottom-placed Parramatta finally opened its account, holding off a fast-finishing North Queensland to triumph 16-12. Follow our NRLW ScoreCentre.

title.children: NRLW live: Dragons clash with Titans after Eels break through for first win of the season

image.altText: An old photo of children walking along a red dirt road

items.synopsis: Half a century ago, the people of Areyonga dreamt of a future where their children learnt "two-ways". Now they're looking to the future of bilingual education.

title.children: 50 years ago, this desert community was at the forefront of an education revolution

image.altText: Ben Sainsbury celebrates world championships victory

items.synopsis: The Australian squad claims three gold among a haul of five medals at the ICF Canoe Sprint and Paracanoe World Championships in Germany.

title.children: Aussie paddlers on top of world champs medal tally after bagging three gold

image.altText: Hairdressing instruments ready for use, generic stock image.

items.synopsis: Thousands of casual and contract workers in childcare, tourism and other industries are now eligible for taxpayer-funded sick and carer's pay, under a Victorian government trial.

title.children: Casual hairdressers and childcare workers to get access to Victorian sick-pay trial

image.altText: Matildas' Mary Fowler puts her gloved hands to her face during Australia's Women's World Cup semifinal match against England.

items.synopsis: Australia is out of the top 10 in FIFA's women's rankings for the first time this year despite the Matildas enjoying their best World Cup performance, while their captain is up for another major award.

title.children: Matildas go from fourth in the World Cup to 11th in the world rankings

image.altText: Two rainbow lorikeets on a post.

items.synopsis: Not every native bird species has suffered since European settlement. Meet the "winged winners" that are doing well in urban gardens.

title.children: These native birds are the 'winged winners' that thrive in our backyards

image.altText: cctv vision after the moment of impact

items.synopsis: Two boys die in hospital and a crime scene is set up after a car hit a tree in the Sydney suburb of Monterey.

title.children: Police probe whether street racing caused Sydney crash that killed boys aged nine and 10

image.altText: Colour portrait of rapper Briggs sitting on a chair in front of black background and some red light.

items.synopsis: As I sat looking at the restaurant bill, Briggs' words took me back to a place I still feel like I've never really left: the uni student who couldn't make ends meet, writes Virgina Trioli.

title.children: The fear of being broke never really does go away

image.altText: White dinner bowl filled with bright orange pumpkin chunks and topped with feta, yoghurt and dill

items.synopsis: Catering for people with chewing or swallowing difficulties can require more planning and forethought. This home cook says it's all about texture and taste doesn't need to suffer.

title.children: What do you serve someone who has trouble swallowing?

image.altText: Tran family in Mekong Restaurant

items.synopsis: The Tran family have worked hard to build their lives in Australia — running and owning an award-winning restaurant — but they say after receiving incorrect migration advice, they could lose it all.

title.children: 'Bad migration advice' throws family's future into jeopardy

image.altText: A crayon drawing of a woman holding a newborn baby

items.synopsis: Mental health has long been a focus for restaurant owner Bianca, but more recently the trauma of losing her baby son has meant she's had to put everything she's learnt into practice in her own life.

title.children: Bianca prioritised mental health for her restaurant staff. Then she suffered a personal tragedy

image.altText: Ricciardo stands up in crashed F1 car

items.synopsis: AlphaTauri's Ricciardo, in just his third grand prix since earning a drive with the Red Bull-backed outfit, fractured his left hand when he and fellow Australian Oscar Piastri crashed on the same turn.

title.children: Daniel Ricciardo to miss Dutch Grand Prix after fracturing hand in crash

image.altText: Satellite image of a plane wreckage in a rural-looking area with trees, fields and a few buildings nearby

items.synopsis: Despite Russian President Vladimir Putin sending the Wagner mercenary boss' family his condolences, the Kremlin says it needs to wait for test results.

title.children: Russia says flight recorders and 10 bodies recovered from wreckage of Prigozhin plane

image.altText: Acceptance of weed

items.synopsis: More than a million prescriptions have been filled since medical cannabis was legalised in Australia in 2016, but patients with chronic pain are refusing to use it so they can continue driving without penalty.

title.children: Cannabis driving laws are lagging behind the science, and medicinal users are not in the driving seat

image.altText: An aerial shot of a small outback community.

items.synopsis: The people of Glenden are breathing a sigh of relief after watching legislation pass in Queensland parliament that will secure the future of their town.

title.children: Emotions run high as tiny town's fate is decided after years of uncertainty

image.altText: close up image of ballarat clarendon college's modern sign

items.synopsis: The ABC understands some teachers at Ballarat Clarendon College have raised concerns with their union about the school's practice of recording classes, saying it increases their anxiety.

title.children: Top private school's staff concerned about class recordings after teacher's expletive-filled rant shared online

image.altText: Matildas players watch on at pitchside as Australian fans in the stands cheer and hold up signs after a big match.

items.synopsis: The Women's World Cup showed Australia can be a footballing nation, but the people in charge have to figure out how to extend that for more than a couple of months.

title.children: With the Women's World Cup in the rear-view mirror, now the real work begins for Australian football to cash in

image.altText: Malka Leifer leans against a car on a street in Israel talking to two men

items.synopsis: A private investigator explains how an undercover operation in a remote community where "everyone knows everyone" helped nab disgraced principal, Malka Leifer.

title.children: How hidden cameras helped force an abuser from her remote, overseas location to face justice in Australia

image.altText: A Jamaican female sprinter poses for photographers with her gold medal and national flag.

items.synopsis: Shericka Jackson retains her world 200 metres championship in the second-fastest time ever run, as Noah Lyles adds another gold to his tally in Budapest.

title.children: Jamaican edges closer to breaking Flo-Jo's 35-year-old world record as US ace completes sprint double

image.altText: A woman's leg in a red show with a flat heal kicks in the air over a puddle

items.synopsis: Ballet flat shoes are making a comeback. Are they safer than stilettos? When you look at the research a complicated picture emerges.

title.children: Ballet flats are back. How do they affect your feet?

image.altText: An aerial photo of a coal power plant surrounded by Australian bush.

items.synopsis: Renewable energy is increasingly the main game in Australia's electricity system, so why are governments stepping in to prop up ageing coal-fired plants?

title.children: 'Mugged by reality': Why taxpayers are on the hook for keeping coal plants online
